pr_title: Capture scope if necessary before Scala 2.13 Transformation enters an ExecutionContext

timeline.message: transfer state when scala 2.13 transformation is mapped

timeline.bodyText: It seems like callbacks could be either Transformation or ManyCallbacks.  Would this still work if multiple callbacks were added to a single promise?
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: Nope, it won't work for multiple callbacks. Or rather I'm not sure what it's supposed to do since this will afaics, take the existing State for the this Transformation and transfer it to the first Transformation that is added to this Transformation. So if you add multiple Transformations only the first one added will get the State. There is a race here as well since adding Transformations can be done concurrently, there is no telling which Transformation actually gets the State.
replies.author: bantonsson

replies.bodyText: I don't think it's actually necessary to set the state in the first Transformation to null, and yes, it was racy.
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: It doesn't need to work with ManyCallbacks - see Promise$Transformation.
replies.author: richardstartin
